boardgame.name: The End of the Triumvirate
Das Ende des Triumvirats
boardgame.description: Players take on the role of one of three leaders in ancient Rome: Caesar, Pompeius, or Crassus. Each is seeking to dominate the others by various means. You could try a military victory by creating a massive land block... or perhaps a political victory by being elected as Consul twice... or perhaps you can win by sheer skill by raising your talents... This game is designed for exactly three players (tackling the usual problems games at this player count have) but comes with a variant to play with only two players as well._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The turn play consist of 3 phases:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1: Supply phase - Each province supplies gold or legions (based on the type of province)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2: Move Phase - The player moves their Character to collect gold or to attack their opponents with Legions following their Character_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;3: Action phase - can be used to do number of actions such as Persuade citizens, produce weapons or increase military or political competence._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The player turn ends by moving the calendar stone one step down the track._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game can be won by three different ways and ends immediately if one of the conditions is achieved:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Political victory: A player is elected for consul twice (by having most citizens in his forum at the end of a year)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Military Victory: A player conquers their 9th Province_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Competence Victory: A player reaches VII on both Competence_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2006 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Z-Man Games (ZMG 7011) It is the year 56 B.C. The Roman Republic is torn by civil war. The historical three-man council (the first Triumvirate between Caesar, Pompeius, and Crassus) could not be renewed at the conference at Luca, and a bitter struggle broke out between the three rivals. Now they seek to eliminate one another, vying to gain supremacy over the empire. But in order to gain power, they must exhibit skill in both politics and military strategy in their quest to the ultimate goal -- individual ascendancy! May Jupiter smile on you.
